findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to stop or pause transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop contracts from transactions and sales for all users by calling specific functions such as `setBlacklist` and setting `tradeCooldown` to a high value.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to transfer tokens from specific address
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to transfer tokens from a specific address.

findings.title: Owner Transfer User's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer user's tokens by abusing admin functions such as stopping transactions and blacklisting addresses.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase fees more than a reasonable percent (25%)
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to set fees but lacks a mechanism to prevent increasing them beyond a reasonable percentage (25%).

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase the amount of liquidity taken by dev wallet more than a reasonable percent
findings.description: The contract owner has unrestricted access to increase the amount of liquidity taken by the dev wallet, which can lead to potential abuse.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to mint new tokens
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to mint new tokens.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to burn tokens from specific wallet
findings.description: The contract owner does not have the ability to burn tokens from a specific wallet.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to blacklist wallets from selling
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop contracts from transactions and blacklist addresses, but there is no mechanism to prevent the owner from abusing this power.

findings.title: Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Functions that are not used in the contract, and make the code's size bigger.

findings.title: Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: The comparison to boolean constants is redundant. Boolean constants can be used directly and do not need to be compared to true or false.
